decks.notes: The deck focuses on using efficient mana ramp creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves to quickly play powerful threats like Lovestruck Beast, Questing Beast, and Steel Leaf Champion. Oko, Thief of Crowns is used to disrupt the opponent's strategy while Rhonas the Indomitable provides a powerful buff to the team. Stubborn Denial offers some protection while Smuggler's Copter and Heart of Kiran provide additional threats and card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive Simic aggro strategy.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays to quickly overwhelm opponents. It utilizes efficient creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Scrapheap Scrounger, along with disruptive spells such as Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. With the ability to quickly deploy threats and disrupt opponents' game plans, this deck aims to apply continual pressure and close out games before opponents can stabilize. Key components like Mutavault and Castle Locthwain provide additional utility and card advantage, while cards like Spawn of Mayhem and Rankle, Master of Pranks offer powerful finishers to secure victories.

This deck focuses on using Green ramp spells to quickly build up mana and control the game with removal and hand disruption. Once the mana is ramped up, the deck aims to generate an overwhelming advantage with cards like Tireless Tracker and Field of the Dead. The deck has a strong mana base with various utility lands to help stabilize the game. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's gameplan early on, ramp up quickly, and overwhelm them with powerful threats and card advantage.

This deck is focused on aggressive gameplay with an emphasis on Mono Black Aggro. The key concept revolves around efficiently controlling the game through a combination of powerful creatures and disruptive spells. The deck aims to pressure the opponent's life total by deploying threats like Knight of the Ebon Legion, Spawn of Mayhem, and Scrapheap Scrounger. It also utilizes powerful disruption tools such as Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck incorporates key synergies and uses strong utility lands like Castle Locthwain to maintain a consistent aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to use Lotus Field along with various card draw and mana ramp spells to quickly assemble a combo that allows for explosive plays, such as casting Omniscience for free or generating massive amounts of mana with Finale of Revelation. The deck focuses on finding and utilizing Lotus Field efficiently while ensuring card advantage and card selection to consistently execute its game plan. Additionally, the sideboard options available through Fae of Wishes provide additional versatility and answers to various situations.

This deck focuses on maximizing early aggression and pressure through a swarm of low-cost creatures and powerful one-drop spells. It utilizes efficient removal and disruptive cards to maintain board control while dealing consistent damage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently, utilizing creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Spawn of Mayhem to close out games before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of scrapheap scrounger and bloodsoaked champion allows for consistent board presence and resilience against removal spells. Overall, the deck aims to win through a fast and relentless assault.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive creatures that benefit from each other's presence on the battlefield. The key strategy is to quickly build a wide board presence of knights and pump them up with cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and History of Benalia. The Circle of Loyalty acts as a late-game finisher, providing more knights and anthem effects. With efficient creatures and strong support cards like Once Upon a Time, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents early and maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main focus of the deck is to utilize aggressive creatures like Lovestruck Beast, Steel Leaf Champion, and Questing Beast, along with efficient mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Gilded Goose, to quickly establish a threatening board presence. Cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns provide additional versatility and disruption, while Stubborn Denial offers protection for your key threats. The inclusion of vehicles like Aethersphere Harvester and Heart of Kiran adds another dimension to the aggro strategy, allowing for additional reach and evasion. Overall, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and overwhelm opponents with a fast, powerful offense.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana with devotion to green creatures and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, while using aggressive creatures like Burning-Tree Emissary and Voracious Hydra to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With powerful planeswalkers like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Vivien, Arkbow Ranger providing additional support and card advantage, this deck aims to pressure the opponent early on and maintain board control throughout the game. The inclusion of versatile cards like Walking Ballista and Once Upon a Time ensures consistency and adaptability in various situations.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana resources with green spells and lands in order to quickly cast powerful, high-cost spells like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. This allows for strong control over the board and the ability to quickly overwhelm opponents with powerful threats. The inclusion of cards like World Breaker and Oblivion Sower helps to disrupt opponents' strategies while maximizing the deck's ramp potential. Castle Garenbrig and Once Upon a Time provide additional ways to accelerate mana production and ensure consistency in the deck's strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Gilded Goose, Llanowar Elves, and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, in order to play powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Voracious Hydra. It also includes disruptive creatures like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Wicked Wolf to control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive creatures and efficient mana ramp, while also having the flexibility to adapt to different situations with its versatile cards.

The main concept of the deck is to stall the game and control the board using counterspells, card draw, and fog effects while ramping up mana with Wilderness Reclamation. Tamiyo, Collector of Tales helps to dig for combo pieces like Nexus of Fate, which allows for taking extra turns until the opponent runs out of resources. The deck aims to establish a lock on the game by continuously casting Nexus of Fate and generating advantage through card draw and mana acceleration, eventually overwhelming the opponent with extra turns and inevitability.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by playing low-cost, aggressive red creatures and burn spells. By maximizing the number of cheap, efficient spells and creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Experimental Frenzy and Light Up the Stage helps ensure a steady stream of threats and burn spells to keep the pressure on the opponent. The deck's mana base is streamlined with Ramunap Ruins and Castle Embereth to provide additional damage sources.

The main focus of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to apply constant pressure on the opponent by utilizing low-cost, evasive creatures and disruptive spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize. The deck aims to maintain a board presence with cards like Knight of the Ebon Legion and Spawn of Mayhem, while also having ways to refill the board with Scrapheap Scrounger and Bloodsoaked Champion. The inclusion of versatile threats like Rankle, Master of Pranks and the card advantage from Castle Locthwain ensure that the deck remains aggressive and resilient throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using green spells and land fetches, while controlling the board with counterspells and board wipes. Once a critical mass of lands is reached, the deck aims to win by either casting Scapeshift to create an army of zombie tokens with Field of the Dead or by drawing cards and gaining life with Sphinx's Revelation. By controlling the game early and ramping up to powerful late-game threats, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponents.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and removal spells to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total and maintain board presence. By combining evasive threats like Smuggler's Copter and resilient creatures like Scrapheap Scrounge, Night Market Lookout, and Knight of the Ebon Legion, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Thoughtseize and Fatal Push help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Spawn of Mayhem and Murderous Rider provide additional threats and removal options.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using green ramp cards to quickly build up mana and accelerate into powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Nissa, Vastwood Seer. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The key strategy is to establish a strong board presence with cards like Tireless Tracker and Elvish Rejuvenator while also utilizing lands like Field of the Dead to generate zombie tokens and overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and burn spells. By playing mana-producing creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves early, the deck aims to quickly ramp into powerful threats like Bonecrusher Giant and Questing Beast. Cards like Captain Lannery Storm and Gilded Goose provide additional mana and resources, while Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Possibility Storm offer additional burn and disruption. Borborygmos Enraged and Enter the Infinite provide late-game power, while Shared Summons can search for key creatures when needed. The deck's flexibility and aggressive playstyle make it a formidable opponent in the Pioneer format.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of green ramp and control elements. The deck aims to quickly ramp up its mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer, Elvish Rejuvenator, and Nissa's Pilgrimage to play powerful threats such as Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, Oblivion Sower, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also utilizes Hour of Promise and Once Upon a Time to consistently find important pieces. Additionally, the deck includes lands like Field of the Dead and Castle Garenbrig to generate additional value and maintain board presence.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing mana dorks and powerful green creatures, it aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Oko, Thief of Crowns provides versatile removal and disruptive capabilities, while cards like Questing Beast and Steel Leaf Champion offer strong combat abilities. With a mix of evasion, card advantage, and resilience, this Simic Aggro deck aims to take control of the board and end the game before the opponent can stabilize.
